intro: Ardisia paradoxa, commonly known as the paradoxical beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are visually striking and attract various bird species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Ardisia paradoxa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
